comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: "Sophie Irene Loeb (July 4, 1876, Rivne, Volhynia, Russia (now Ukraine) – January 18, 1929) was a US journalist and social-welfare advocate." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sophie_Irene_Loeb

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: There is also a more comprehensive biographical sketch of her at jwa.org/encyclopedia/article/loeb-sophie-irene-simon There is a monument to her in Central Park, a fountain for a playground she had championed: daytoninmanhattan.blogspot.com/2013/09/the-1936-sophie-lo... www.nycgovparks.org/parks/centralpark/monuments/935

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of February 3, 1916 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FB0D11F6355C1373... indicates that Senator George F. Thompson of Niagara suggested her as a candidate for the Public Service Commission because he was not in favor of Travis Whitney (neighboring photo), the nominee of the Governor.

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Senator George F. Thompson See also comments there

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: All: Thanks for both the background on Loeb as well as suggestions as to why her photo was taken at this particular time. We will expand the decscription and of this and the other photo of Loeb.
